intro: Didymoplexis obreniformis var. maliauensis, commonly known as the Maliauensis Trumpet Vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in humid, shaded environments within its native range. The flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its habitat.
